U.S. Accused of Passing Bill on Human Rights of North Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Minjok Thongsin of south Korea ran a commentary on July 23, condemning the U.S. for passing a bill on human rights of north Korea through the House of Representatives on July 21.
 The commentary said that the bill, in a word, contains a sinister intention to interfere in the internal affairs of the north and impair its sovereignty under the cloak of human rights and freedom and the bill was faked up by the U.S. ultra right conservatives from the outset.    
 It is important for the compatriots in the south and north and overseas to pool their efforts to conduct a powerful campaign for rejecting the anti-human rights bill.

articles.content:
Reception Given by Swiss Resident Coordinator 
    Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Ueli Muller, resident coordinator of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation of the Federal Department of Foreign Affairs in Pyongyang, gave a reception Thursday on the occasion of the national day of Switzerland.
 Present on invitation were officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.content:
Games for "Jonsung Cup" Held
    Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- The games for "Jonsung Cup" were held in Pyongyang, Wonsan, Nampho and other cities on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
 The players competed in swimming, yacht race, synchronized swimming, water skiing, water polo, diving and other maritime sports events.    
 The April 25 sports group came first in diving, the sports group of the Ministry of Fisheries in water polo and swimming and the sports group of the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport in boat and canoe races.
